title: E field - conducting sphere charge from given E

content.question: If the electric field is due only to the excess charge of the sphere, what is the magnitude of the excess charge that is on the surface of the sphere?

choices.label: <math alttext="2.0 times 10 to the negative 8 power coulomb" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></mrow></msup><mtext>C</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="8.0 times 10 to the negative 8 power coulomb" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>8.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.8 times 10 to the negative 7 power coulomb" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>1.8</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></mrow></msup><mtext>C</mtext></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1.8 times 10 to the negative 7 power coulomb" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>1.8</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></mrow></msup><mtext>C</mtext></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
